entry.title: Armenia again cuts interest rates amid low inflation, high growth: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia again cuts interest rates amid low inflation, high growth: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs new economy minister insisted there is no systemic corruption within his agency and pledged his priority would be to diversify the country‚Äôs trade ties. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank this week cut interest rates to 8.5%, as inflation in the country continues to remain well below target levels and the economy continues to grow. üìç Armenia said it expects Russia to keep natural gas prices low through at least 2031, even as ties between the countries continue to worsen dramatically.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Yerevan city official arrested on bribery charges in latest corruption probe

media:group.media:title: Yerevan city official arrested on bribery charges in latest corruption probe
media:group.media:description:
üìç Four men arrested in Yerevan are accused of planting improvised explosives targeting officials affiliated with the ruling Civil Contract party. üìç An unnamed Yerevan municipal official has been arrested and charged with bribery, along with four other individuals, after law enforcement officials raid the Department of Architecture and Urban Development. üìç Foreign Minister signals still no concrete progress on resolving the main issues preventing Armenia and Azerbaijan from signing a normalization agreement. üìç Also Watch: Bridging Continents - Expanding Europe-Asia Defense Cooperation https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CBKRFNKgS_U üìç Also Read: Oscar-winning ‚ÄòThe Last Repair Shop‚Äô documents journey through Baku pogroms https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/767864/oscar-winning-the-last-repair-shop-documents-journey-through-baku-pogroms/

media:group.media:description:
üìç Russia warned Armenia that the country‚Äôs accelerating tilt to the West could cause ‚Äúirreparable damage‚Äù to bilateral relations. üìç The European Union‚Äôs legislative arm urged the bloc to consider granting Armenia candidate status, the first step to potential membership. üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://youtu.be/h3_DSaozLac

entry.title: New concessions will not bring peace, but humiliation

media:group.media:title: New concessions will not bring peace, but humiliation
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of insights Eric Hacopian discusses Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs statements at the March 12 press conference regarding withdrawal from a Russian-led security alliance, as well as the European Parliament‚Äôs groundbreaking resolution supporting Armenia‚Äôs bid for EU integration.

‘π’∏÷Ç÷Ä÷Ñ’´’°’µ’´ ’∂’°’≠’°’£’°’∞ ’å’•’ª’•÷É ‘π’°’µ’´÷É ‘∑÷Ä’§’∏’≤’°’∂’® ÷É’∏÷Ä’±’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ’©’´’¥’°’Ø’´÷Å’∂’•÷Ä’´ ’ª’°’∂÷Ñ’•÷Ä’® ’¥’´’°’æ’∏÷Ä’•’¨ ’¥’°÷Ä’ø’´ 31-’´’∂ ’Ω’∫’°’Ω’æ’∏’≤ ÷Ñ’°’≤’°÷Ñ’°’µ’´’∂ ’®’∂’ø÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’´÷Å ’°’º’°’ª÷â ’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©’´ ’∞’•’ø ’¶÷Ä’∏÷Ç’µ÷Å’∏÷Ç’¥ ’∫’∏’¨’Ω’°’¢’∂’°’Ø ’∞÷Ä’°’∫’°÷Ä’°’Ø’°’≠’∏’Ω ’å’∏’¢’•÷Ä ’î’∏÷É’©’°’∑’®, ’æ’•÷Ä’¨’∏÷Ç’Æ’•’¨’∏’æ ‘∑÷Ä’§’∏’≤’°’∂’´ ’∞’°’µ’ø’°÷Ä’°÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’®, ’∏÷Ä ’¥’°÷Ä’ø’´ 31-’´ ’®’∂’ø÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’∏÷Ç’∂’∂’•÷Ä’∂ ’´÷Ä ’∞’°’¥’°÷Ä ’æ’•÷Ä’ª’´’∂’∂ ’•’∂ ’¨’´’∂’•’¨’∏÷Ç, ’∂’∑’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß, ’∏÷Ä ’ç’ø’°’¥’¢’∏÷Ç’¨’´ ’∞’°’¥’°÷Ä ’∫’°’µ÷Ñ’°÷Ä’´ ’•’¨÷Ñ’® ’Ø’°÷Ä’∏’≤ ’ß ’Ø’°’∂’≠’∏÷Ä’∏’∑’•’¨ ’•÷Ä’Ø÷Ä’´ ’∞’°’ª’∏÷Ä’§ ’∂’°’≠’°’£’°’∞’´’∂÷â
‘∏’Ω’ø ’î’∏÷É’©’°’∑’´’ù ‘π’∏÷Ç÷Ä÷Ñ’´’°’µ’´ ’´’∑’≠’∏’≤ ’∏÷Ç’™’® ÷É’∏÷Ä’±’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ’£’∂’°’¨ ’ç’°’∞’¥’°’∂’°’§÷Ä’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂ ÷É’∏÷É’∏’≠’∏÷Ç’©’µ’°’∂’ù ’§÷Ä’°’∂’∏’æ ’°’¥÷Ä’°’∫’∂’§’•’¨’∏’æ ’´÷Ä ’§’´÷Ä÷Ñ’•÷Ä’®÷â ’î’∏÷É’©’°’∑’∂ ’°’∂’§÷Ä’°’§’°’º’∂’∏÷Ç’¥ ’ß ’∂’°÷á ’©’∏÷Ç÷Ä÷Ñ’°’Ø’°’∂ ’¨’´÷Ä’°’µ’´ ’°÷Ä’™’•’¶÷Ä’Ø’¥’°’∂’∂ ’∏÷Ç ’ø’∂’ø’•’Ω’°’Ø’°’∂ ’≠’∂’§’´÷Ä’∂’•÷Ä’´’∂÷â
